title: Engineering Quality Risk Indicators Analysis
text:
Introduction
The Engineering Quality Risk Indicators (EQRI) initiative aims to measure risk to engineering quality as a counterpoint to existing cost and schedule metrics and to give PDTs and Technical Leads a tool to help them leverage their voice for quality.

Visit the EQRI app (USACE employees only)
Read More on the USACE KM Portal (USACE employees only)

title: Engineering Quality Risk Indicators Analysis
text:
FY25 Question Analysis
The purpose of this website is to provide a detailed Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) summary of the FY25 version of the EQRI questionnaire. To explore these results, use the items on the top menu:

Questions - Results for each question are presented and summarized by key USACE organizational units.
Indicators - Results for each indicator (a metric derived from a topical grouping of questions) summarized by key organizational units.

title: Questions
text:
Is there an Engineering Technical Lead (TL) assigned to the project with an active professional registration (e.g., P.E., R.A., P.L.A., P.G., etc.) or waiver from the Chief of the District’s Engineering Function?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Is there an Engineering Technical Lead (TL) assigned to the project with an active professional registration (e.g., P.E., R.A., P.L.A., P.G., etc.) or waiver from the Chief of the District’s Engineering Function?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q2: PDT disciplines
Does the design team have all the necessary members (i.e., technical disciplines) assigned given the project scope?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q3: QAQC disciplines
Do the QA/QC review teams have all the necessary members (i.e., technical disciplines) assigned given the project scope?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q4: Design experience
Does the design team have sufficient relevant design experience with projects of similar scope and complexity?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q5: PDT mentors
Are senior staff mentors assigned to all design team members with less than two years of professional design experience?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q6: Member capacity
Do the design and review team members have capacity to actively support the project?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q7: Engaged centers
Have the relevant Mandatory Centers of Expertise (MCX), Technical Centers of Expertise (TCX), and/or Centers of Standardization (COS) been identified and engaged on the project?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q8: Permitting authorities
Have the relevant permitting authorities been identified and engaged on the project?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q9: Assumptions valid
Are the assumptions made during planning/programming still valid (e.g., real estate, environmental, geotechnical, hydraulics and hydrology, survey, and other pertinent assumptions)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q10: Class 3 estimate
At the start of design, is there a sufficient level of scope definition and design maturity to support a Class 3 estimate?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q11: Updated TPCS
Was the Total Project Cost Summary (TPCS) certified within the last two years?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q12: Deviation waiver
At the current time, can the project be implemented without deviations from mandatory design criteria or receiving an approved waiver from HQUSACE?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q13: Lessons learned
Have lessons learned been evaluated and incorporated into the design?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q14: Design expectations
Did the Project Delivery Team (PDT) establish design expectations by milestone and communicate those in the Project Management Plan (PMP), Architect-Engineer (A-E) contract, and/or brokered work agreement, etc.?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q15: Standard milestones
Does the project schedule include all standard practice design milestones?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q16: Design time
Does the project schedule include sufficient design time to accomplish all design related milestones?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q17: QAQC time
Does the project schedule include sufficient time for Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA) reviews during all required design submittals?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q18: Survey time
Does the project schedule include sufficient time to complete engineering investigations and surveys (e.g., cultural, geotechnical, environmental, hazardous materials, etc.) in time to adequately inform the design?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q19: Permitting time
Does the project schedule include sufficient time to complete permitting process(es)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q20: Schedule alignment
Is the current design team schedule in alignment with the project schedule in the Project Management Plan (PMP)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q21: Current QMP/RP
Does the project have a current, approved project-specific Quality Management Plan (QMP)/Review Plan (RP)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q22: DQC prior
Did District Quality Control (DQC) occur prior, and not concurrent with, to the Independent Technical Review (ITR)/Agency Technical Review (ATR)/Biddability, Constructability, Operability, Environmental and Sustainability (BCOES) Review?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q23: QMP/RP followed
Was the Quality Management Plan (QMP)/Review Plan (RP) followed for this review milestone?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q24: Computations QC
Have all computations gone through a rigorous Quality Control (QC) process (e.g., a “red dot” review)? (Note: For A-E work, it is incumbent upon the Technical Lead (TL) to ensure the A-E has performed this level of review.)








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q25: Plans QC
Have all critical graphics/plans gone through a rigorous QC process (e.g., a “red dot” review)? (Note: For A-E work, it is incumbent upon the Technical Lead (TL) to ensure the A-E has performed this level of review.)








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q26: Specs QC
Have all specifications gone through a rigorous QC process? (Note: For A-E work, it is incumbent upon the Technical Lead (TL) to ensure the A-E has performed this level of review.)








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q27: Models QC
Have all models gone through a rigorous QC process? (e.g., a “red dot” review, clash detection, etc.)? (Note: For A-E work, it is incumbent upon the Technical Lead (TL) to ensure the A-E has performed this level of review.)








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q28: Compliant BCOES
Has a Biddability, Constructability, Operability, Environmental, and Sustainability (BCOES) review been performed in compliance with the ER?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q29: Complete DQC, ITR/ATR, BCOES
Have District Quality Control (DQC), Independent Technical Review (ITR)/Agency Technical Review (ATR), and Biddability, Constructability, Operability, Environmental, and Sustainability (BCOES) certifications been completed?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q30: Updated QMP/RP
Has the Quality Management Plan (QMP)/Review Plan (RP) been updated to respond to significant project changes?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q31: Design adequacy
Does the design adequately accomplish the project scope, intent, and functional and technical objectives as defined in the current Project Management Plan (PMP)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q32: Deliveralbe expectations
Did the deliverable meet established design milestone expectations?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q33: Cost design maturity
Is the design maturity sufficient to generate the required Class of estimate for this milestone? (Class 3 at 35%, Class 2 at 65%, and Class 1 at 95%/100%)








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q34: Current Risk Register
Does the project have a current risk register?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q35: 35% CSRA
Was the project budget verified with a Cost Schedule Risk Analysis (CSRA) at concept design (i.e., 35%)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q36: District PA
Did the Geographic District validate and/or develop the Programmed Amount (PA)?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q37: Team turnover
Has there been turnover on your design or review team that may affect the team’s ability to develop a quality product?








by District

title: Questions
text:
Q38: Design confidence
What is your level of confidence in the quality of the engineering design efforts on this project?








by District

title: Indicators
text:
Indicators
